title: Matildas vs New Zealand : Sam Kerr set to lead the charge | The Advertiser - Cessnock
body_text:
Sam Kerr is back for the Matildas and Hunter sports fans will get a chance to watch the star striker and her Australian teammates take on New Zealand in Gosford next month.
Subscribe now for unlimited access.
or signup to continue reading
Foootball Australia annunced on Tuesday that the Matlidas will tackle the Black Ferns in a two-match series during the November/December FIFA international window.
The first game will be held at Polytec Stadium on Friday, November 28. The date and venue for the second game is yet to be confirmed, but is likely to be played outside of NSW.
Kerr is set to make her hotly anticipated return for the Matildas against Wales in Cardiff early Sunday morning (ADST) before facing European champions England in Derby four days later.
The 32-year-old last played for Australia in November 2023, having endured a horror 20-month rehabilitation from an ACL tear suffered at a Chelsea training camp in January 2024.
Baring a mishap, Newcastle's Matildas regulars Emily van Egmond and Clare Wheeler will also be in the squad to meet New Zealand.
The series is part of the preparation under new coach Joe Montemurro for the Women's Asian Cup 2026 to be held in Australia next March.
Jets recruits, striker Kelli Brown and keeper Anna Leat, are in contention for the Black Ferns squad.
MORE HERALD SPORT
The last time the two sides met was in a 2022 two-match series with Australia coming out on top with 2-1 and 3-1 victories in Townsville and Canberra respectively.
"We are delighted the CommBank Matildas will be heading to Gosford for what promises to be a fantastic night of football," Football Australia Interim chief executive Heather Garriock said.
"New Zealand has played a pivotal role in our history and over the years the rivalry has grown into one of mutual respect and fierce competition.
"Playing at Polytec Stadium gives us a chance to connect with our Central Coast fans and to showcase the team's talent and spirit in a region that is passionate about football."
The Matildas have been box-office hits in Newcastle and Hunter fans are expected to travel to Gosford in big numbers.
A record crowd 28,019 watched a Mary-Fowler inspired side beat Korea Republic 2-0 at McDonald Jones Stadium on April 7.
The attendance figure eclipsed the city's previously biggest Matildas crowd in Newcastle of 20,495, set against global powerhouse United States on November 30, 2021.
Tickets for the game in Gosford are on sale from Thursday.
